wikipedia_page.main: Colonel Henry Bromley (fl. 10 March 1803 - d. 1836) was Member of Parliament for Worcester City from the General Election in October 1806 until he resigned on 13 February 1807, rather than defend a bribery allegation by the defeated candidate.On 10 March 1803 he inherited the Manorship of Abberley together with the patronage of St. Mary's church in the village.
